member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SCHM.AddSCHMResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Add tags to a resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SCHM.AddSCHMResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Schemas.Model.TagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SCHM.AddSCHMResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SCHM.AddSCHMResourceTagCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

para.para: Specifying this limits the results to only this schema version.

summary.para: The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SCHM.GetSCHMDiscoveredSchemaCmdlet
member.summary: Get the discovered schema that was generated based on sampled events.

para.para: An array of strings where each string is a JSON event. These are the events that were used to generate the schema. The array includes a single type of event and has a maximum size of 10 events.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SCHM.GetSCHMDiscoveredSchemaCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Content'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Schemas.Model.GetDiscoveredSchemaResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Schemas.Model.GetDiscoveredSchemaResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Type parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Type' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SCHM.GetSCHMDiscovererListCmdlet
member.summary:
List the discoverers.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para: Specifying this limits the results to only those discoverer IDs that start with the specified prefix.
Specifying this limits the results to only those ARNs that start with the specified prefix.

summary.para: The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.

para.para: The token that specifies the next page of results to return. To request the first page, leave NextToken empty. The token will expire in 24 hours, and cannot be shared with other accounts.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SCHM.GetSCHMDiscovererListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Discoverers'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Schemas.Model.ListDiscoverersResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Schemas.Model.ListDiscoverersResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SCHM.GetSCHMDiscovererListCmdlet.NoAutoIteration
member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SCHM.GetSCHMRegistryListCmdlet
member.summary:
List the registries.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para: Specifying this limits the results to only those registry names that start with the specified prefix.
Can be set to Local or AWS to limit responses to your custom registries, or the ones provided by AWS.

summary.para: The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.

para.para: The token that specifies the next page of results to return. To request the first page, leave NextToken empty. The token will expire in 24 hours, and cannot be shared with other accounts.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SCHM.StopSCHMDiscovererCmdlet
member.summary: Stops the discoverer

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SCHM.StopSCHMDiscovererCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Schemas.Model.StopDiscovererResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Schemas.Model.StopDiscovererResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SCHM.StopSCHMDiscovererCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the DiscovererId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^DiscovererId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SCHM.StopSCHMDiscovererCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SCHM.UpdateSCHMDiscovererCmdlet
member.summary: Updates the discoverer

para.para: Support discovery of schemas in events sent to the bus from another account. (default: true)
The description of the discoverer to update.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SCHM.UpdateSCHMDiscovererCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Schemas.Model.UpdateDiscovererResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Schemas.Model.UpdateDiscovererResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SCHM.UpdateSCHMDiscovererCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the DiscovererId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^DiscovererId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SCHM.UpdateSCHMDiscovererCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SCHM.UpdateSCHMSchemaCmdlet
member.summary:
Updates the schema definition
Inactive schemas will be deleted after two years.

para.para: The ID of the client token.
The source of the schema definition.
The schema type for the events schema.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SCHM.UpdateSCHMSchemaCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Schemas.Model.UpdateSchemaResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Schemas.Model.UpdateSchemaResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SCHM.UpdateSCHMSchemaCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
